channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report E-2023080163
item.description:
Report E-2023080163

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLU experienced a customer location release of UN1090 Acetone from a box containing (4) 1-gallon metal cans. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and located one cardboard box of LAPALM Acetone that was slightly wet with residual Acetone. There were no wet spots or residual product on the trailer floor. The XPO driver had already separated the damaged box and delivered the rest of the load to the customer. Contractors placed the box into a 55-gallon metal drum which was then transported back to XPO terminal XLU located in Louisville, KY and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet on trailer, QA was called. Package was picked up and put into a lined tote. DescribePack: Cap had come loose during transit causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was kept in an upright position to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023071244
item.description:
Report X-2023071244

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY, ONE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING. THE PACKAGE HAD DANGEROUS GOODS PAPERWORK AND WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTION. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO 5 LITER CONTAINERS OF ASP CIDEX OPA CONCENTRATE. ONE OF THE CONTAINERS WAS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on the enamo grip became loose. We used spill pads to clean up the spilled product. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote DescribePack: cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080097
item.description:
Report X-2023080097

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on the ground on the load side with the outer packaging wet. The package was place in a hazmat bag lined red tote and taken back to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: One of the caps on the plastic gallon bottle was slightly loose causing a small amount of liquid to spill from the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as the outer package was found to be wet a hazmat trained administrator placed the corrosive hazmat in a red tote. No liquid escaped the package.

item.title: Report X-2023080072
item.description:
Report X-2023080072

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on the load side with the outer bottom of the box wet. Upon inspection the metal can inside of the package was dented causing the screw on lid of the can to leak. The spill was cleaned up with absorbent pads and no other packages were affected. DescribePack: The screw on lid slightly leaked due to improper handling of the hazmat package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fold absorb was used for the small amount of liquid that needed cleaned up and the package was put into a hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023070492
item.description:
Report X-2023070492

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: INSPECTED PACKAGE CONTENTS DUE TO RECENT UNDECLARED PACKAGES BEING DISCOVERED FROM THE SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EIGHT INNER BOXES MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTION WITH CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABELS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. EACH OF THOSE EIGHT INNER BOXES CONTAINED 10 X 100 ML (3.4 OZ) BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE EPIDIOLEX SOLUTION. THE TOTAL AMOUNT FOR THE ENTIRE SHIPMENT WAS 8000 ML (271 OZ). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023070321
item.description:
Report X-2023070321

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY A TWO-PIECE CONSIGNMENT FROM INDIANA TO TEXAS WAS INSPECTED TO FIND FIVE MEDICAL DEVICES CONTAINING LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z4499070201205648 CONTAINS FOUR STRYKER PHOTONBLADE ELECTROSURGICAL INSTRUMENTS. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z4499070201205657 CONTAINS ONE STRYKER PHOTONBLADE ELECTROSURGICAL INSTRUMENT. EACH SURGICAL DEVICE CONTAINS ONE CR123A 3V LITHIUM METAL BATTERY IN THE EQUIPMENT. THERE IS NO LITHIUM BATTERY MARK APPLIED TO EACH BOX AS REQUIRED PER THE REQUIREMENTS OF IATA PI 967, SECTION II. THERE IS A PACKING LIST INSIDE EACH BOX WHICH INDICATES THE CONTENTS ARE HAZMAT. THE OUTER BOXES ARE PREPRINTED OVERPACK. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
